feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Cold Front Moving Through Late Sunday and Monday... A strong cold front will push from west to east across the Interior and Alaska Range late Sunday into Monday. This will bring much cooler temperatures, periods of gusty winds, and a wintry mix of rain and snow. Precipitation with the front will initially fall as rain, before switching over to snow Sunday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 3:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wintery Weather Expected Through Monday... A series of weather fronts will move into the West Coast and Western Interior through the rest of the weekend and into Monday, bringing cooler temperatures, gusty winds, and snow. The first front has already moved into the West Coast as of this afternoon, bringing light snow and gusty south-southwest winds to the area.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 5:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SIGNIFICANT PATTERN CHANGE FOR SOUTHWEST ALASKA THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK... A Fall-like period will take shape as a series of fronts move through Southwest Alaska this weekend. The first front will move to the Kuskokwim Delta coast this evening spreading a rain/snow mix to all regions. Another front quickly follows on Sunday
